author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Everything you need to know about Baylor-Texas Tech, including predictions, analysis, TV listings and more
text:
No. 5 Baylor vs. Texas Tech
Texas Tech and Baylor have faced each other 73 times on the gridiron dating back to 1929. The series is currently deadlocked (36-36-1) until the two teams meet on Saturday where Tech coach Kliff Kingsbury will try for his first win against the Bears. Baylor introduced a new trophy into the equation this season, which will be awarded to the winner of the Texas Farm Bureau Insurance Shootout. Last year's meeting was indeed a shootout, in which the Bears emerged victorious despite six touchdown passes from Patrick Mahomes. Saturday's matchup also marks the first time in school history the Red Raiders will play back-to-back top-five nationally ranked teams. Texas Tech is the nation's only program to face two top-five opponents in its first five games of the 2015 season and was seconds away from topping then-No. 3 TCU last week. Mike DuPont.
Who: No. 5 Baylor Bears (3-0, 0-0 Big 12) vs. Texas Tech (3-1, 0-1)
When: 2:30 p.m. Saturday
Where: AT&T Stadium in Arlington
Line: Baylor -14.5 (as of Monday morning)
TV/radio: ABC / KFXR-AM 1190, KSKY-AM 660
